The Sad State of Printed Tech Books - Andreas Weis - ACCU 2025 Short Talks
---

Why has the printing quality of technical books declined so drastically? In this eye-opening lightning talk, Andreas Weis dives deep into the sad state of printed tech books. From print on demand issues and blurry text to poor book binding quality and digital printing artifacts, this video uncovers the overlooked problems plaguing today's technical book publishing.

We explore the growing concerns around book printing quality, particularly in programming books, software engineering books, and other technical books. Whether you're a developer, academic, or just someone who loves well-made books, you'll learn how to spot bad printing quality in books — including fuzzy text, glossy paper issues, and poor thread binding. 

Andreas shares real examples of print defects in books and explains how publishers’ shift to print on demand has led to reduced publishing
title: The Sad State of Printed Tech Books - Andreas Weis - ACCU 2025 Short Talks
